description: Highest common factor (or GCD) of n^n and hyperfactorial(n-1), i.e. GCD(n^n, product(k^k) for k<n).
comments: Sequence could be defined as: a(2) = 1, a(4) = 4, a(8) = 65536, a(9) = 19683; if p an odd prime: a(p) = 1 and a(2p) = (4p)^p; otherwise if n>1: a(n) = n^n.
references: Mohammad K. Azarian, On the Hyperfactorial Function, Hypertriangular Function, and the Discriminants of Certain Polynomials, International Journal of Pure and Applied Mathematics, Vol. 36, No. 2, 2007, pp. 251-257.  Mathematical Reviews, MR2312537.  Zentralblatt MATH, Zbl 1133.11012.
links: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..200
prog: (Python)from gmpy2 import gcdA056582_list, n = [], 1for i in range(2,201):    m = i**i    A056582_list.append(int(gcd(n,m)))    n *= m # _Chai Wah Wu_, Aug 21 2015
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jul 03 2000
